briefdescription.para: Soft reset the sensor.
Resets the ABOC context.
Saves the force calibration offset into the non volatile memory.
Resets the forced calibration correction factor.
Enum defining the different device commands.
The device does not perform any CO2 concentration measurement.
The device triggers a single measurement sequence.

detaileddescription.para: At the end of the measurement sequence, the device automatically goes back to idle mode.

briefdescription.para: The device periodically triggers a CO2 concentration measurement sequence.

detaileddescription.para: Once a measurement sequence is completed, the device goes back to an inactive state and wakes up automatically for the next measurement sequence. The measurement period can be programmed from 5 seconds to 4095 seconds.

briefdescription.para: Enum defining the different device operating modes.
No offset compensation occurs.
The offset is periodically updated at each BOC computation.
Forced compensation.
Enum defining the different device baseline offset compensation (BOC) modes.
PWM single-pulse.
PWM pulse-train mode.
Enum defining the PWM mode configuration.
Pin INT is configured as push-pull and is active LOW.
Pin INT is configured as push-pull and is active HIGH.
Enum defining different interrupt active levels.
Pin INT is inactive.
Pin INT is configured as the alarm threshold violation notification pin.
Pin INT is configured as the data ready notification pin.
Pin INT is configured as the sensor busy notification pin.
Pin INT is configured as the early measurement start notification pin.

simplesect.para: This function is available only in continuous mode

briefdescription.para: Enum defining different pin interrupt functions.
CO2 ppm value falling below the alarm threshold.
CO2 ppm value rising above the alarm threshold.
Enum defining whether an alarm is issued in the case of a lower or higher threshold violation.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 device using the I2C interface.

detaileddescription.para: It initializes the dev structure, verifies the integrity of the communication layer of the serial communication interface, and checks whether the sensor is ready

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device structure allocated by the user, but the init function will initialize its contents
Pointer to the platform-specific I2C communication handler

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the initialization was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Initializes the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 device using the UART interface.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device structure allocated by user, but the init function will initialize its contents
Pointer to the platform-specific I2C communication handler

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the initialization was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

Start register address
Pointer to the data buffer to be written in the sensor
Number of bytes of data to be written

Start register address
Pointer to the data buffer to store the register values of the sensor
Number of bytes of data to be read

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if reading from the register was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if reading the product id was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device
Pointer to populate with the sensor device status

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if reading the device status was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Clears the sensor device status bits.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device

ORed combination of the following values:
XENSIV_PASCO2_REG_SENS_STS_ICCER_CLR_MSK Clears the ICCER status sticky bit
XENSIV_PASCO2_REG_SENS_STS_ORVS_CLR_MSK Clears the ORVS status sticky bit
XENSIV_PASCO2_REG_SENS_STS_ORTMP_CLR_MSK Clears the ORTMP status sticky bit

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the status bits clearing was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

Pointer to populate with the sensor device interrupt configuration

New measurement rate to apply [5-4095s]

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if setting the measurement rate was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Gets the measurement status of the sensor device.

detaileddescription.para: Used to check if a new CO2 concentration value is available to be read (status.b.drdy) using xensiv_pasco2_get_result Used to check if an interrupt is asserted (status.b.int_sts). Used to check if an alarm is triggered (status.b.alarm)

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device
Pointer to populate with the sensor device measurement status

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if getting the measurement was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Clears the measurement status of the sensor device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device

ORed combination of the following values:
XENSIV_PASCO2_REG_MEAS_STS_INT_STS_CLR_MSK Clears the sticky bit MEAS_STS.INT_STS and forces the INT pin to inactive level
XENSIV_PASCO2_REG_MEAS_STS_ALARM_CLR_MSK Clears the sticky bit MEAS_STS.ALARM

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if clearing the measurement status selected bits was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Sets the alarm threshold.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device
New alarm threshold value to apply

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if setting the alarm threshold was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Sets the pressure compensation value.

detaileddescription.para: The CO2 concentration value acquired by the sensor is dependent on the external atmospheric pressure. To compensate for this effect, the application can provide the value of the atmospheric pressure using this function. At the end of a measurement sequence, the device reads the pressure value and applies it for compensation on the CO2 concentration value before storing it into the result registers, and can be retrieved using xensiv_pasco2_get_result

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device
New pressure compensation value to apply

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if setting the pressure reference value was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Sets the offset compensation value Defines the reference value used for ABOC and force calibration.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device
New pressure calibration value to apply

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if setting the measurement offset was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if writing to the scratch pad register was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device
Measurement rate to apply [5-4095s]

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if starting the measurements was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Performs force compensation.

detaileddescription.para: Used to calculate the offset compensation when the sensor is exposed to a CO2 reference value. The device is left is idle mode and the new offset compensation value is stored in non-volatile memory.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor device
Command to trigger

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the force compensation was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (void *ctx, uint16_t dev_addr, const uint8_t *tx_buffer, size_t tx_len, uint8_t *rx_buffer, size_t rx_len)
memberdef.name: xensiv_pasco2_plat_i2c_transfer

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function to perform I2C write/read transfer.

detaileddescription.para:
Synchronously writes a block of data and optionally receive a block of data.
ctx
Target platform object
dev_addr
device address (7-bit)
tx_buffer
I2C send data
tx_len
I2C send data size
rx_buffer
I2C receive data
Can be NULL to indicate no read access.
rx_len
I2C receive data size
XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the I2C transfer was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function to read over UART.

parameterdescription.para: UART object
Receive buffer
Number of bytes to receive

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the UART read was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function to write over UART.

parameterdescription.para: UART object
Transmit buffer
Number of bytes to transmit

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the UART write was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function that waits for a specified time period in milliseconds.

parameterdescription.para: Number of miliseconds to wait for

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function to reverse the byte order (16-bit)

parameterdescription.para: Value to reverse

simplesect.para: Reversed value

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function that implements a runtime assertion; used to verify the assumptions made by the program and take appropiate actions if assumption is false.

parameterdescription.para: Expression to be verified

briefdescription.para: Result code indicating a successful operation.
Result code indicating a communication error.
Result code indicating that an unexpectedly large I2C write was requested which is not supported.
Result code indicating that the sensor is not yet ready after reset.
Result code indicating whether a non-valid command has been received by the serial communication interface.
Result code indicating whether a condition where VDD12V has been outside the specified valid range has been detected.
Result code indicating whether a condition where the temperature has been outside the specified valid range has been detected.
Result code indicating that a new CO2 value is not yet ready.
Minimum allowed measurement rate.
Maximum allowed measurement rate.
I2C address of the XENSIVâ„¢ PASCO2 sensor.
Library which provides a platform-independent driver for the XENSIVâ„¢ PAS CO2 sensor.

detaileddescription.para: It provides full access to all features of the sensor.

The library depends on the target platform-specific implementation of the following functions:
xensiv_pasco2_plat_i2c_transfer
xensiv_pasco2_plat_uart_read, xensiv_pasco2_plat_uart_write
xensiv_pasco2_plat_delay
xensiv_pasco2_plat_htons
xensiv_pasco2_plat_assert

The driver provides a default implementation of these functions with weak linkage. xensiv_pasco2_plat_i2c_transfer must be overridden when using the I2C interface. xensiv_pasco2_plat_uart_read, xensiv_pasco2_plat_uart_write must be overridden when using the UART interface. xensiv_pasco2_plat_delay must be overridden with an appropriate implementation for the target platform that delays the processing for a certain number of milliseconds. xensiv_pasco2_plat_htons implements byte reversing in C and can be overridden optionally to optimize the performance if the target platform provides a specific instruction to byte reversing. xensiv_pasco2_plat_assert is implemented using the standard assert.h, and can be optionally overriden for the target platform.
See the implementation example of these functions in xensiv_pasco2_mtb.c
